column2: KANSAS PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: Kansas
column6: KS

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column6: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.

column2: 2. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.
column6: you cannot pass.

column2: 3. Bicyclists must:
column4: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column6: remain near the left edge of the road.
column8: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.

column2: 4. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 5. Which statement about driving and drugs is true?
column4: Only illegals drugs can impair your driving.
column6: Even over the counter drugs can impair your driving.
column8: Prescription drugs are safe to use if they don't make you feel drowsy.

column2: 6. This sign means:
column4: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only
column6: Detour to the right

column2: 7. When passing another car, you have enough room to return to the driving lane when:
column4: you can see both headlights of the car you passed in your rearview mirror.
column6: you are at least 50 feet in front of the vehicle.
column8: you cannot see the vehicle directly to your right.

column2: 8. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.
column6: Honk your horn.
column8: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.

column2: 9. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column6: Yes.
column8: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.

column2: 10. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column6: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.

column2: 11. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: slow down and keep well to the left.
column6: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the right.

column2: 12. Collisions can happen more often when:
column4: one lane of traffic is traveling faster than the others.
column6: one vehicle is traveling faster than the flow of traffic.
column8: all vehicles are traveling at the posted speed limit.

column2: 13. When you see this sign, you should:
column4: be prepared to stop if children are in the crosswalk.
column6: always stop at the crosswalk.
column8: slow down, proceed with caution and watch for blind people.

column2: 14. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column6: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column8: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.

column2: 15. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull the steering wheel back.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 16. When driving at night, drivers should:
column4: always use their high beams.
column6: look directly into the oncoming headlights of approaching vehicles.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Do not block intersection
column6: Merging traffic

column2: 18. When you hear the warning signal or see the warning lamps of an emergency vehicle, you must:
column4: provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle and stop.
column6: stop as quickly as you can.
column8: drive slowly until the emergency vehicle has passed.

column2: 19. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
column4: Yield
column6: School zone

column2: 20. When in a vehicle, wear a seat belt:
column4: at all times.
column6: on long trips.

column2: 21. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.
column6: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column8: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.

column2: 22. This sign means:
column4: You must make a U-turn.
column6: Hairpin corner ahead.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: Trucks merging from the right
column6: Hill

column2: 24. What does a flashing red light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 25. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.
column6: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
